plot: Alex, a boy who lives with and cares for his eccentric grandmother Miriam in his father's absence, lives by responding to the roll of a die, which is how he decides to punch Alo. But he intrigues Liv, who joins him in his die-rolling activities after meeting Miriam, who likes her. The others are less impressed, especially Mini, who accuses Liv of spending too much time with Alex. After Grace's emotional funeral, Alex comforts Liv, but she's newly upset when he says he's gay and uninterested in her as a girlfriend. Reconciliation of a sort comes when Alex gathers everybody together on a boat he has hired to give Miriam, who has just died and was a sailor's widow, a burial at sea.—don @ minifie-1
